content: the motif which starts with p1 in mc p1 k3 2 times p1 k2 37 stitches altogether nsiezee dll e 2 should have the rest of the stitches needle 1 p1 k3 3 times 16 stitches of the motif whihc starts with p1 in mc p1 k3 3 times p1 41 stitches altogether needle 2 should have the rest of the stitches of the round move the heel markers for one stitch each toward each other let us call them gusset markers from now on the last stitch on the right of the first gusset marker and the first stitch on the left of the second gusset marker are knits these two knits will be used for gusset decreases work the instep stitches according to chart a when required remember there are 11 13 15 rounds of simple stitch intarsia motif between cabled part of the motif now every odd round on needle 2 starting with the first round after rearranging work as set to two stitches before the first gusset marker k2tog sm knit to the second gusset marker sm ssk work as set to the end of the needle 2 even rounds on needle 2 are worked as set repeat the two rounds until the sole needle contains 31 35 39 stitches from this point on the sole is 6 worked in stockinette remove the gusset markers cut cc filaments when they are not needed afnoyomt ore leave ends long enough for weaving in continue the foot until you have at least 3 full chart a repeats in total then work 11 13 15 row of the simple part of intarsia on the instep then continue with chart c knit all sole stitches after completing chart c the instep continues in mc with r15 of chart c as long as needed ttoheesre are 19 21 24 rounds for the toes needed set up round k1 ssk work 27 31 35 stitches as set k2tog k1 place the instep marker knit all rst1it ches to the bor 62 70 78 stitches 31 35 39 on each needle r2 knit all stitches r3 knit all stitches k1 ssk knit to the last three stitches before the instep marker k2tog k1 sm k1 ssk knit to the last three stitches before bor k2tog k1 repeat r2-r3 5 6 7 times 38 42 46 stitches 19 21 23 on each needle repeat r3 until you have 18 22 22 stitches 9 11 11 on each needle graft using kitc hener stitch knit the second sock enjoy wearing 7 charts chart a the cabled part of the motif leg and instep all sizes chart b the triangular heel flap and the motif at the back of the leg negative numbers denote stitches that are added from the middle to the right and positive numbers denote stitches that are added to the left chart b starts with row 0 which indicates the last row before increases for the triangular heel start 8 chart c
